text: (gentle music)

- Form3 is a cloud native
payment technology provider.

We run a platform that
enables financial services

to move their difficult and
complex payment processing

onto our platform for scale,
resilience, and functionality/
(gentle music)

Form3 was established
just under six years ago

to tackle the challenge
faced by many small
and large financial institutions.

The limited choice of legacy
technology estates that they

either already ran or software
that they would need to buy
to make payments work for their customers.
So we were formed to use
and leverage the cloud native technology

from many other industries
that had reached maturity

and really try and tackle
the quite difficult nut

of how would you use that
technology to reinvent

and reimagine the way that
payment processing would be done
by a financial institution.
(gentle music)
Taking on financial services, clients,

and critical services like
payments for those clients
poses a number of challenges.

The first is how do we
evidence the security
of a cloud native platform?

And we've been able to do that
by building security directly

into the application and
infrastructure of our business,
leveraging the tools of AWS
and our own developed tools in many cases.

The second challenge we've
needed to overcome is really to,

to leverage the technology
to evidence resilience.
Payments just have to work.

There's no option about
them sometimes working.

It's a very very
sensitive resiliency area.
And so leveraging AWS and cloud tools

and cloud native technology
really allows us to show

to financial institutions that
resilience can be designed

into platforms and the
operational resilience can be

significantly improved over
and above levels achieved

with proprietary data
centers that are expensive
and complicated to maintain.

And I think the third challenge
that we've had to face

with our, with our customers
has been the idea of moving

these services to a
third party organization.

So typically again these
have been managed in house

and so we've been able
to use the technology

and our own understanding of
the payments ecosystem to,

to reassure clients
that payment processing
needn't be complex.

It can be run on a platform
very very successfully.

And that's what, what
Form3 have been doing

over the last five, six years.
(gentle music)
Form3 was born in the cloud.
It was born in AWS.

And so we have had a long
and sustained relationship

leveraging the tools
and capabilities of AWS
to achieve our aims.
This includes the use of AWS
for our key production environments.

Those are processing many
many tens of millions

of transactions a month
for regulated businesses

across the UK and Europe,
soon to be the US.

We've also taken the
opportunity to use AWS

to allow us to cycle up
and build environments

for our rapidly expanding
development teams quickly,
efficiently, and cheaply.

And that's allowed us
to progress very quickly

with the development of key
functionality to support our,
to support our customers.

What's also been really
interesting in the relationship

with AWS from, from our
perspective is the availability

of bright and very
technically astute architects

who've worked with our cloud
native engineers to bring all

of that expertise together to
make sure that the solutions

that we build and the
platform that we've delivered
is something which can stand the test of,
of financial institutions' customers.
(gentle music)
We see a number of benefits in Form3
from having worked with AWS.

Firstly, the maturity at the
beginning of our life cycle
of the AWS technical estate has enabled us
to move more quickly into production.

It's enabled us to move
more rapidly into scale
and it's enabled us to do that

whilst maintaining our
agility for development.
And that's not an easy thing to do.

And we've leveraged all the
tools we can find in AWS

and our own manufactured tools
to help us to achieve that.
Those are all significant benefits.
In run the ability to, to really scale,
scale into consistent processing has been,
has been very valuable for us.
And that is underpinned by the stability

and the continued good performance
of AWS in both resilience

and technical performance.
(gentle music)
The Form3 solution has become integrated

and integral to some of the
largest financial institutions

in the world and their
ability to deliver payments
for their end customers.

The benefits therefore of
leveraging the scaling, security,

and resilience model of public
cloud and particularly AWS,

that's really really
enabled us to evidence
and continue to build on our platform for,
for the benefit of those customers.
That means they know it's secure.

They know it's gonna work all
the time and they absolutely

know that it will deal with
whatever scale or change that,

that they need us to,
need us to throw to them.

Form3 sees AWS as a critical
partner in our expansion.
We've worked with them since our,

since inception and
will do into new markets
and into new functional developments,
specifically being able to take the same

technical understanding that
we've leveraged out of the UK

and Europe and use that
to build our platform

out into the US will be
happening very shortly

and we'll be leveraging
AWS to achieve that.
As we move through our functional roadmap

we will also start to
look through how do we,

how do we really expand
on the data analytics

and understanding of flows
running across our platform?

And we're looking forward
to exploring with AWS tools
that would be developed that might help us
with that process.

And we're also looking
forward to sharing with AWS
our experience of critical infrastructure
of the regulated businesses.

It's imperative that financial
institutions understand

and really leverage the
capabilities of cloud for,
for important and critical services.

And we are just at the
start of that journey

and we're looking forward
to working alongside AWS

to leverage their experience
but also to share our own about
how and where this works most effectively

and to the benefit of ultimately
us all as end consumers

of banks and other financial
services businesses.
(gentle music)
